segment.documentation: GIS, A segment to give processing indicators relating to the whole message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to specify relevant parties for the whole transaction.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to specify the name and address and the related function of the party involved.
CTA, A segment to identify a person or a department to whom communication should be directed.
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a department, or a person to whom communication should be directed.
RFF, A segment to specify the references of the party identified in the leading NAD segment.
DTM, A segment to specify dates, times and periods relating to the whole message.
FTX, A segment to provide free form text information regarding the message and to give description relating to the references given in the previous RFF segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to allow the identification of the data which will be used to group the information reported.

segment.documentation: ARD, A segment to identify the amounts which follow as relating to losses, premiums or cessions.
CUX, A segment to identify the currency in which data will be expressed.
GIS, A segment to transmit general indicators relating to the section.
LOC, A segment to allow for the grouping of details by the geographical scope of the contract.
DTM, A segment to specify dates and periods relating to the information reported.
FTX, A segment to provide free text information regarding a section of the message, or the loss or event.
RFF, A segment to give technical account sub-account references, loss references, layer or surplus number of the reinsurance contract, or bordereau section sequence number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to report detailed information per bordereau 'lire' or to report a total for one specified bordereau section.

segment.documentation: REL, A segment to identify the direct relationship between the data contained in the segment group 3.
RFF, A segment to specify references associated with the bordereau 'line'.
GIS, A segment to transmit processing indicators relating to a bordereau 'line'.
LOC, A segment to specify location details relating to a bordereau 'line'.
NAD, A segment to specify the name and address and the related function of the party involved in the policy or contract.
DTM, A segment to specify dates and periods relating to the line information reported.
FTX, A segment to provide free text information regarding the loss or risk insured, the name of the conveyance vessel or aircraft associated with the reported policy or retroceded contract.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to give the maximum loss percentages, and the shares of co-insurers, leading insurer or ceding company involved in the original policy.

segment.documentation: PCD, A segment to specify percentages relating to the maximum loss, original policy and cedant's share.
NAD, A segment to specify the name and address of the co-insurer, leading insurer or ceding company.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to allow the specification of monetary amounts, both in original and reporting currency.

segment.documentation: MOA, A segment to specify monetary amounts relating to the policy or contract, or to totals of a single section of a message.
GIS, A segment to give general indicators relating to the processing of the amounts.
PCD, A segment to report percentages associated with the amount given in the leading MOA segment.
DTM, A segment to give the date on which settlement of the original policy amounts between insurer and client is due, or to give a date associated with the amount given in the leading MOA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to give references, type of communication and date of an associated message relating to the section total.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to specify references relating to the associated message.
DTM, A segment to give dates relating to the supported message or document, or to give the reinsurance accounting period and periodicity, if the supported message is a reinsurance account.
COM, A segment to specify the means by which the supported message or document has been or will be transmitted.
CUX, A segment to specify the original currency and exchange rate used to convert an amount into the reference currency.
UNS, A segment to separate detail and summary sections of the message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to allow 'roll-up' totals for multiple bordereau sections to be given, and reference to the supported message, sub-account or document to be made, if appropriate.

segment.documentation: MOA, A segment to specify a monetary amount relating to the 'roll-up' total.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments to allow reference to the supported message, sub-account or document to be made.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to specify references related to the 'roll-up' totals and supported messages.
DTM, A segment to give dates relating to the supported message or document, or to give the reinsurance accounting period and periodicity, if the supported message is a reinsurance account.
COM, A segment to specify the means by which the supported message or document has been or will be transmitted.
PCD, A segment to report percentages associated with the amount given in the leading MOA segment, or percentage shares of specified parties, or other percentages that apply across message sections.
